nodes.name: G-Mode Morph Junction (By Bottom Left Door)
nodes.note: Represents being at the bottom left door with G-Mode and morph or artificial morph.

nodes.name: G-Mode Overloaded PLMs Junction (By Bottom Left Door)
nodes.note: Represents being at the bottom left door with G-Mode and PLMs overloaded.

enemies.note: They move around the external walls even when offscreen, and can be brought to any of their home nodes.
It circles around on one of the grapple panels.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Aqueduct Bootless Suitless Snail Climb
reusableRoomwideNotable.note: Snail Climb without movement items by better coordinating the movements of both the snail and Samus.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Aqueduct Snail Clip
note: Jump on the Snail when it is at a precise location, and then crouch jump through the ceiling and jump again, without moving between jumps.
The Snail's positioning is very precise, but it is more lenient with Morph and an X-Ray Turn Around. X-Ray can also be useful for helping position the Snail.
This clip can be used to get to the middle left door and the items in the top right of the room.

reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Aqueduct G-Mode Overload PLMs - PB the Items
note: PLMs can be overloaded in direct G-Mode with a single Power Bomb if both items are still there and 2 PBs if only one item is.
There is a row of tiles that works, just above and to the left of the right door.
The row is one tile higher than the horizontal pipe that is part of the door frame, spanning from the left to one tile away from the right wall.

to.devNote: This link is only for strats that can't go from 9 -> 2 -> 5.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Yard
G-Mode Morph Break the Power Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Place a Power Bomb then exit G-Mode.

strats.name: Stored Moonfall Clip
note: Moonfall twice into the wall adjacent the Power Bomb blocks and then wiggle out to the right.
Then moonfall again to clip through the Power Bomb Blocks
Without Gravity, break spin to avoid clipping down too far.

strats.name: Aqueduct Left-Side X-Ray Climb (Upper)
note: Climb up 1 screen.
Aim to end this XRay climb when Samus is visually near but not above the top of the left side door.
Fall out of the wall by turning to the right, from a crouch if possible.
This XRay climb has a window of 4 crouches, but with a way to break bomb blocks it can be ended earlier.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs - Bomb the PB Blocks
strats.note: Bomb the Power Bomb blocks below to overload PLMs, then go up through the crumble blocks to escape.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs - Bomb the Power Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Bomb the Power Bomb blocks below to overload PLMs, then IBJ up through the crumble blocks to escape.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs - Bomb the PB Blocks
strats.note: Bomb the PB blocks below to overload PLMs, then go up through the crumble blocks to escape.

strats.name: Snail Clip to the Left Middle Door
note: Jump on the Snail when it is at a precise location, and then crouch jump through the ceiling and jump again, without moving between jumps.
The Snail's positioning is very precise, but it is more lenient with Morph and an X-Ray Turn Around. X-Ray can also be useful for helping position the Snail.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 1 screen, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Snail Jump
strats.devNote: HJBless SpringBall jumps require less obvious snail positioning.

strats.name: Aqueduct Bootless Suitless Snail Climb (Crab Shaft Door)
note: Stop the snail when it is on the lower part of the overhang (hug the snail to gain extra jump height).
Climb it by waiting until it is just about to become active to jump.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged with a Fast WallJump Climb
G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Yard
Suitless Shinespark
strats.devNote: This is obscure enough that it's assumed you can canShinechargeMovementComplex

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: A very precise CrouchJumpDownGrab, or springball jumping to the snail is closer to canSnailClimb.

strats.name: Aqueduct Bootless Suitless Snail Climb (Right Door)
note: Stop the snail when it is on the lower part of the overhang (hug the snail to gain extra jump height).
Climb it by waiting until it is just about to become active to jump.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs - PB the Items (To the Items)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Aqueduct G-Mode Overload PLMs - PB the Items
note: PLMs can be overloaded in direct G-Mode with a single Power Bomb if both items are still there and 2 PBs if only one item is.
There is a row of tiles that works, just above and to the left of the right door.
The row is one tile higher than the horizontal pipe that is part of the door frame, spanning from the left to one tile away from the right wall.
strats.devNote: This does not include canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess, as it is only worth doing this strat if the items are there.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs - PB the Items (To the Items)
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Aqueduct G-Mode Overload PLMs - PB the Items
note: PLMs can be overloaded in direct G-Mode with a single Power Bomb if both items are still there and 2 PBs if only one item is.
There is a row of tiles that works, just above and to the left of the right door.
The row is one tile higher than the horizontal pipe that is part of the door frame, spanning from the left to one tile away from the right wall.
strats.devNote: This does not include canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess, as it is only worth doing this strat if the items are there.

strats.name: Snail Climb
strats.note: Watch out for snails coming from above, or aggressive snails from below, who will either block or attack Samus.

strats.name: Aqueduct Bootless Suitless Snail Climb (Top Door)
note: Stop the snail when it is on the lower part of the overhang (hug the snail to gain extra jump height).
Climb it by waiting until it is just about to become active to jump.
Watch out for snails coming from above, or aggressive snails from below, who will either block or attack Samus.

strats.name: Suitless Shinespark, Low Run Speed
strats.note: Start running next to the transition (But at least 1 pixel away) so that Samus has very low run speed.
strats.devNote: Starting with low run speed is less obvious than trying to shortcharge.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs with Grapple
strats.note: Overload PLMs using the Grapple Blocks.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport Below Bomb Blocks
note: Hold Grapple through the transition and then immediately release it to teleport below the Bomb blocks.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged
strats.devNote: It is possible, although not overly useful, to extend the runway here using a snail.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Yard
devNote: Requires no items or tech if you step on a Snail - canUseEnemies is necessary for G-Mode Setup.

strats.name: Snail Clip to the Items
note: Jump on the Snail when it is at a precise location, and then crouch jump through the ceiling and jump again, without moving between jumps.
The Snail's positioning is very precise, but it is more lenient with Morph and an X-Ray Turn Around. X-Ray can also be useful for helping position the Snail.

strats.name: Shinespark
devNote: It is possible, although not overly useful, to extend the runway here using a snail.
FIXME: It is possible to use a snail here and in Shaktool's room to extend the runway at the door.
This can be useful when short charging, but can not be used to leave running, as running on the snail does not work.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport (from Moat)
strats.note: Press down immediately after teleporting, in order to get above the bomb blocks.

G-Mode Overload PLMs with Grapple
strats.note: Overload PLMs using the Grapple Blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
strats.devNote: FIXME: This is doable with just Bombs and entering on the left side.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Snail Platform
note: The two snails together can setup G-Mode on either side of the door.

strats.name: G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.devNote: Requires entry on either side of the doorway, but not the center.

strats.name: G-Mode Overload PLMs with Grapple
strats.note: Overload PLMs using the Grapple Blocks.

strats.name: Aqueduct Snail Stuck Moonfall
note: Use two snails to perform an 'Enemy Stuck Moonfall' to bypass the bomb blocks above the middle left door of Aqueduct.
Position one snail on the above door shell, and the second above the corner of pipe below
Samus will clip through the lower snail, taking damage, then continue through a segment of pipe where the crumble blocks can be reached.
Facing both snails during the moonfall while positioning Samus for the clip can be precise
Depending on the exact heights of the snails, it may be necessary to pose change while clipping.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Yard, from Above
Aqueduct Top Door Snailstep
strats.note: Involves waiting around for a snail to come along, in order to reach the door by jumping while standing on it.

strats.name: Aqueduct Top Door Crouch Jump
strats.note: Crouch on rightmost pixel of the ledge to the left of the door, jump then move over quickly without spin jumping.

strats.name: Overload PLMs - Bomb the Speed Blocks, To the Middle Left Door
Break the Power Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Place a Power Bomb, then exit G-Mode to break the blocks.

strats.name: Overload PLMs - Bomb the Speed Blocks, To the Top Right Items
Overload PLMs - Bomb the Speed Blocks
Overload PLMs - Bomb the Speed Blocks
strats.note: Bomb the Speed blocks by the right door.

strats.name: Overload PLMs - Morphed Suitless Snail Climb
Overload PLMs - Morphed Suitless Snail Climb, No Jump Assist
note: It is barely possible to start a snail climb with just Spring Ball.
Get a snail positioned such that it is on the bottom of an overhang above, and sticking out a bit to be usable as a platform.
Use Spring Ball to jump and press against the snail for the maximum possible duration, in order to gain enough height to get onto it.

strats.name: G-Mode Overloaded PLMs Through the Bomb Blocks
strats.note: After PLMs are overloaded, climb to the top left door and fall through the Bomb Blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Overloaded PLMs Through the Speed Blocks
strats.note: After PLMs are overloaded, use a snail to help climb to the top right items.
